quotes.text: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak and remove all doubt.
quotes.author: Maurice Swizer
quotes.attribution: Mrs Goose, Her Book', 1907, evolved from Proverbs 17:28

quotes.text: He can compress the most words into the smallest idea of any man I know.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: The best thing about the future is that it comes one day at a time.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: I am just a businessman, giving the people what they want.
quotes.author: Al Capone

quotes.text: A wit with dunces, and a dunce with wits.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.text: The covers of this book are too far apart
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.text: A stitch in time saves embarrassment.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Absence makes the heart go wander.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Better late than never—but never late is better.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: He who laughs last just didn't get the joke.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Invention is the mother of necessity.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: The early worm gets eaten first.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: The pen is mightier than the sword—until the sword is drawn.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: The squeaky wheel gets the grease—until it gets replaced.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Too many irons in the fire make the blacksmith nervous.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Where there's a will, there's a lawsuit.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: My idea of an agreeable person is a person who agrees with me.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.text: Never apologize and never explain.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.text: Talk to a man about himself and he will listen for hours.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.text: There are three kinds of lies: lies, damned lies, and statistics.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.text: When men are pure, laws are useless; when men are corrupt, laws are broken.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.text: Fish and visitors stink after three days.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Brevity is the soul of lingerie.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: Men seldom make passes at girls who wear glasses.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: You can't teach an old dogma new tricks.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: You're a good example of why some animals eat their young.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: A fool and his money are soon invited everywhere.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard
quotes.attribution: The Roycroft Dictionary and Book of Epigrams 1923

quotes.text: If a thing is worth doing, it is worth doing badly.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.text: It's better to waste one's youth than do nothing at all
quotes.author: Georges Courteline

quotes.text: Behind every successful man is a woman, behind her is his wife.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: He hasn't been himself lately, but then again who has?
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: How much would you charge to haunt a house?
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: I've had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: Marriage is a wonderful institution, but who wants to live in an institution?
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: Tell me, was it you or your brother who was killed in the war?
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: Those are my principles, and if you don't like them, well, I have others.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: Youth would be an ideal state if it came a little later in life.
quotes.author: H.H. Asquith

quotes.text: Liberty is the right to do whatever the law allows.
quotes.author: Henri Monnier (as M. Prudhomme)

quotes.text: Love and scandal are the best sweeteners of tea.
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.text: Posterity is as likely to be wrong as anybody else.
quotes.author: Heywood Broun

quotes.text: She never lets ideas interrupt the easy flow of her conversation
quotes.author: Jean Webster

quotes.text: Facts are stubborn things.
quotes.author: John Adams
quotes.attribution: Argument in Defense of British Soldiers (1770)

quotes.text: That depends, sir, upon whether I embrace your policies or your mistress.
quotes.author: John Wilkes
quotes.attribution: reply to Earl of Sandwich when he said 'You'll die on the gallows or of some disease'

quotes.text: The man who thinks he knows it all has a lot to learn.
quotes.author: Josh Billings
quotes.attribution: Josh Billings' Encyclopedia of Wit and Wisdom 1874

quotes.text: I used to be Snow White, but I drifted.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: The only thing I regret about my past is the length of it.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: When women go wrong, men go right after them.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.text: If you want something said, ask a man; if you want something done, ask a woman.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.text: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.text: I didn't attend the funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: The reports of my death have been greatly exaggerated.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Curiosity can do more things than kill a cat.
quotes.author: O. Henry

quotes.text: A gentleman is one who never hurts anyone's feelings unintentionally.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Always borrow money from a pessimist. He won't expect it back.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Education is an admirable thing, but nothing worth knowing can be taught.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I can believe anything, provided that it is quite incredible.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I can resist everything except temptation.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I think that God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Nothing succeeds like excess.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: One can survive everything nowadays except death.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: There is no sin except stupidity.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: When people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Every crowd has a silver lining.
quotes.author: P.T. Barnum

quotes.text: History repeats itself. Historians repeat one another.
quotes.author: Rupert Brooke

quotes.text: A little inaccuracy sometimes saves tons of explanation.
quotes.author: Saki

quotes.text: The harder I work, the luckier I get
quotes.author: Sam Goldwyn

quotes.text: He is not only dull in himself,  but the cause of dullness in others
quotes.author: Samuel Foote
quotes.attribution: speaking of a law-lord, recounted in Boswell's life of Johnson

quotes.text: A great many people mistake obstinacy for firmness.
quotes.author: Sydney Smith

quotes.text: Many a man calls himself a philosopher who is only a bore.
quotes.author: Sydney Smith

quotes.text: The only way to be comfortable is to be uncomfortable first.
quotes.author: Sydney Smith

quotes.text: I'd rather be strongly wrong than weakly right.
quotes.author: Tallulah Bankhead

quotes.text: If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner.
quotes.author: Tallulah Bankhead

quotes.text: Only good girls keep diaries. Bad girls don't have the time.
quotes.author: Tallulah Bankhead

quotes.text: There is less in this than meets the eye.
quotes.author: Tallulah Bankhead

quotes.text: This is no time to make new enemies.
quotes.author: Voltaire when asked to renounce the devil

quotes.text: I am free of all prejudices. I hate everyone equally.
quotes.author: W.C. Fields

quotes.text: Start every day off with a smile and get it over with.
quotes.author: W.C. Fields

quotes.text: He found it inconvenient to be poor
quotes.author: William Cowper
quotes.attribution: on the subject of a burgler in 'Charity', 1782

quotes.text: Some people can stay longer in an hour than others can in a week.
quotes.author: William Dean Howells

quotes.text: A modest little person, with much to be modest about.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: He has all the virtues I dislike and none of the vices I admire.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Madam, if I were your husband I would drink it.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill
quotes.attribution: to Lady Astor who said she'd poison his coffee

quotes.text: It ain't over till it's over.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: It's like deja vu all over again.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: Nobody goes there anymore, it's too crowded.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: The future ain't what it used to be.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: You can observe a lot by watching.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: It gets late early out there.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: If you can't imitate him, don't copy him.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: I knew the record would stand until it was broken.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: A nickel ain't worth a dime anymore.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: You wouldn't have won if we'd beaten you.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: Pair up in threes.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: We're lost, but we're making good time.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: The towels were so thick there I could hardly close my suitcase.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra
